definition: ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations

sentences.english: You were spanked: You're a sneaky adult.
sentences.chinese: 如果你被打耳光，你將成爲一個鬼鬼祟祟的人。

sentences.english: Which part of Manifest Destiny does sneaking under EastChina Sea belong?
sentences.chinese: 鬼鬼祟祟的去東海這又算是哪門子天定命運？

sentences.english: Eventually, you'll become a very sneaky adult.
sentences.chinese: 最終，你會變成一個鬼鬼祟祟的人。

sentences.english: What are you doing skulking around here?
sentences.chinese: 你在這幹嘛，鬼鬼祟祟的？

sentences.english: Godness knows what they're being so secretive about.
sentences.chinese: 兩個人鬼鬼祟祟的，不知說些什麼。

sentences.english: The secret to this kind of malicious gossip is not furtiveness.
sentences.chinese: 這種惡毒流言的內情是不會鬼鬼祟祟的。
她們看起來十分緊張，甚至有些鬼鬼祟祟。

sentences.english: His furtive behaviour aroused our suspicion.
sentences.chinese: 他鬼鬼祟祟的行爲引起了我們的懷疑。

sentences.english: There’s a touch of demon in his stealthy menace.
sentences.chinese: 在他鬼鬼祟祟的威脅中有一種惡魔的氣質。

sentences.english: The snake continues its stealthy hunt.
sentences.chinese: 這隻青蛇繼續鬼鬼祟祟的打獵。

sentences.english: This way no one feels they're being dishonest or sneaky.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，誰都不會再覺得對方虛情假意鬼鬼祟祟。

sentences.english: There's a suspicious looking man lurking about outside.
sentences.chinese: 有一個可疑的人在外面鬼鬼祟祟地活動。

definition: lit. to behave like a thief/furtive/underhand
to stick one's head out and look around (idiom)
to look in all directions (idiom)/to glance around
to evade/to dodge (out of the way)
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
see 賊眉鼠眼|贼眉鼠眼[zei2 mei2 shu3 yan3]
